intro: Machaeranthera pinnata f. glaberrima, commonly known as the smoothleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is characterized by its glabrous (smooth) leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. This variety is distinguished by its reduced hair coverage compared to other forms of Machaeranthera pinnata.
